question: A Batch Operating System processes jobs in real-time with direct user interaction.
A Multi-Programmed OS increases CPU utilization by switching between programs.
Time-Shared Operating Systems allocate a small time slot to each user to create the illusion of simultaneous execution.
A Multiprocessor OS is designed to run on a single-core processor only.
Distributed Operating Systems connect multiple computers to work as a single system.
A Real-Time Operating System (RTOS) ensures that critical tasks are executed without any delay.
Mobile Operating Systems are designed specifically for personal computers.
Batch Operating Systems are mainly used in payroll processing and bill generation.
Multi-Programmed Operating Systems reduce CPU idle time by managing multiple programs.
Time-Shared Operating Systems are also known as real-time systems.
Multiprocessor Operating Systems use multiple CPUs to enhance performance.
Distributed Operating Systems cannot function without an internet connection.
Real-Time Operating Systems are commonly used in life-critical systems like medical devices and air traffic control.
Android and iOS are examples of mobile operating systems.
Batch Operating Systems execute jobs one after another without any user intervention.
A Multi-Programmed OS allows only one process to run at a time.
Time-Shared Operating Systems improve user experience by providing each user with a dedicated CPU.
Multiprocessor systems can be used in supercomputers for complex calculations.
Google Search and cloud computing services use distributed operating systems.
A Real-Time Operating System cannot be used in robotics and industrial automation.
Mobile Operating Systems are optimized for touchscreen devices.
Batch Operating Systems provide immediate responses to user inputs.
In a Time-Shared Operating System, multiple users share system resources efficiently.
A Multiprocessor OS decreases processing speed by distributing tasks among multiple processors.
Distributed OS improves system fault tolerance by distributing tasks among different computers.
A Soft Real-Time OS allows slight delays in task execution.
Android OS is an open-source mobile operating system developed by Google.
iOS is an open-source mobile operating system available for all mobile manufacturers.
Time-Shared Operating Systems are commonly used in cloud computing environments.
Real-Time Operating Systems are not used in medical devices like heart monitors.
